intro: Gymnotheca cicutifolia, commonly known as the cutleaf gymnotheca, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves that are often deeply lobed or divided. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. Gymnotheca cicutifolia is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
